gurmukhi: XoN kih kY bqIXw jm ko kiv rwm khY pun ju`D kIE hY ]BUq siRMgwln kwkn Jwkn fwkn sRon AGwie pIE hY ]
transliteration: Yon Kah(i) Kai Bateeyaajam Ko Kavi Raam Kahai Poun Juddh Keeo Hai|| Bhoot Sringadlan Kaakan Jhaakan Daakan Sron Aghaae Peeo Hai||
translation: After saying these words, according to the poet Ram, the king was engaged in war with Yama; in this war the ghosts, jackals, crows and vampires drank the blood to their heart’s content;

gurmukhi: mwirXo mrY n khUM jm qy niRp mwnhu AMmiRq pwn kIE hY ]pwn lIE Dn bwn jbY iqn AMqk AMq Bjwie dIE hY ]1488]
transliteration: Maariyo Darai Na Kahoon Jam Te Nrip Maanoh Anmrit Paan Keeo Hai|| Paan Leeo Dhan Baan Jabai Tin Antak Ant Bhajaae Deeo Hai||1488||
translation: The king is not even dying with the blows of Yama, it appears that he has quaffed ambrosia; when the king took his bow and arrows in his hands, the Yama had to run away ultimately.1488.

gurmukhi: jb jm dIE Bjwie kiRSn hyir niRp XO kihXo ]lrqy ikauN nhI Awie mhwNrQI rn DIr qum ]1489]
transliteration: Jab Jam Deeo Bhajaae Krishan Her Nrip Yau Kahiyo|| Larte Kion Nahiaae Mahaanrathiran Dheer Toum||1489||
translation: With Yama was made to run away, then king, seeing towards Krishna said, “O the great warrior of the battlefield ! why do you not come to fight with me?” 1489.

gurmukhi: jo hir mMqR ArwDq hYN qp swDq hYN mn mYN nhI AwXo ]j`gX kIey bhu dwn dIey sB Kojq hYN iknhUM nhI pwXo ]
transliteration: Jo Har(i) Mantra Araadhat Hain Tap Saadhat Hain Man Main Nahiaayo|| Jaggya Keee Bahu Daan Deee Sabh Khojat Hain Kinhoon Paayo||
translation: He, who through the repetition of mantras and through the performance of austerities, does not come to abide in the mind; who is not realized through the performance of Yajnas and giving charities;

gurmukhi: bHm scI piq nwrd swrd bXws prwsr sRI suk gwXo ]so biRj rwj smwj mY Awj hkwr kY ju`D ky kwj bulwXo ]1490]
transliteration: Brhm Sachipat(i) Naarad Saarad Byaas Paraasar Srisouk Gadyo|| So Brij Raaj Samaaj Mai Aaj Hakaar Kai Juddh Ke Kaaj Bulaayo||1490||
translation: Who is eulogised by even Indra, Brahma, Narada, Sharda, Vyas, Prashar and Shukdev; to that Krishna, the Lord of Braja, today the king Kharag Singh invited him from the whole society for war by challenging him.1490.

gurmukhi: qb hir j`C AsqR kir lIno ]AYNc kmwn Cwf sr dIno ]nl kUbr mn gRIv su Dwey ]suq kubyr ky dÍY ieh Awey ]1491]
transliteration: Tab Har(i) Jachchh Astra Kar(i) Leeno|| Ainch Kamaan Chhaad Sar Deeno|| Nal Koobar Man Greev Su Bhaae|| Sout Kouber Ke Dvai Eh Aae||1491||
translation: Then Krishna took the Yakshastra (the arm relating to Yakshas) in his hand and pulling his bow discharged it; now both the sons of Kuber, Nalkoober and Manigreev came in the battlefield.1491.

gurmukhi: Dnd j`C ikMnr sMg lIny ]ey Awey mn mY irs kIny ]sgl sYn iqn kY sMg AweI ]DweI ]BUp soN krI lrweI ]1492]
transliteration: Dhanad Jachchh Kinnar San Leene|| E Aae Man Mai Ris Keene Sagl Sain Tin Kai San Aaee|| Dhaae Bhoop Son Karilaraaee||1492||
translation: They took many Yakshas, the generous bestowers of wealth, and kinnars alongwith them, who, getting enraged, reached the battlefield; all the army came with them and they waged a terrible war with the king.1492.

gurmukhi: kop kIey sB SsqR lIey kr mY iml kY iqh pY qb Awey ]BUp inKMg qy kwF kY bwn kmwn ko qwn su KYNc clwey ]
transliteration: Kop Keee Sabh Shastra Leee Kar Mai Mil Kai Tih Pai Tab Aae|| Bhoop Nikhanndte Kaadh Kai Baan Kamaan Ko Taan Su Khainch Chadhaae||
translation: In great rage, taking their weapons in their hands, all of them together fell upon the king; the king, taking out the arrows from his quiver, discharged them, pulling his bow;

gurmukhi: hoq Bey ibrQI ibn sUq Gny qb hI jm lok pTwey ]TwFo n koaU rihXo iqh TOr sBY gn ikMnr j`C prwey ]1493]
transliteration: Hot Bhae Birthibin Soot Ghane Tab Hijam Lok Pathaae|| Thaadho Na Ko( i)  Rahiyo Tih Thaur Sabhai Gad Kinnar Jachchh Paraae||1493||
translation: The warriors and charioteers were deprived of their chariots and the king dispatched them to the abode of Yama; none of them could stay at that place all the Yakshas and Kinnars fled away.1493.
